title: Cleveland Browns Troll Stephen A. Smith With Latest Mashup Post Playoff Confirmation - EssentiallySports
text:
Stephen A. Smith must bow as the Cleveland Browns got off a roller-coaster ride. It won‚Äôt be an exaggeration to say that QB Joe Flacco has stitched up the perfect comeback script. The Browns made it to the playoffs after throttling the Jets with a 37-20 victory. At the moment, if Stephen A. Smith isn‚Äôt regretting his choice of words, he must play Brown‚Äôs viral mashup on repeat.
America‚Äôs Favorite Video Today
The veteran journalist, known for providing valuable insights on sports across the country, said the Cleveland Browns season is over. The Browns not only celebrated a massive win with fans waving the ‚ÄúBeware of the Dawgs‚Äù banners on the sidelines, but they also made sure to give Stephen A. Smith a taste of his own medicine.
The Cleveland Browns send Stephen A. Smith a friendly reminder ADVERTISEMENT

A month ago, when the Browns were going through QB struggles, Stephen A. Smith compared the team with the Jets. The Browns have now come forward and given a fitting reply by comically trolling the veteran. Post win the Browns shared the post on X. The clip was a throwback to Stephen A. Smith‚Äôs confident words, ‚ÄúLadies and gentlemen, the Cleveland Browns season is over.‚Äù He then drew a comparison with the Jets QB struggles straightaway, ‚ÄúThey ain‚Äôt nothing more than the New York Jets now.‚Äù

The video cut short his statement and shifted the focus on the Browns‚Äô win over the Jets as they made the playoffs. The post had a hilarious quote that was related to their four QB changes, ‚Äúour season was said to be over like 4 different times.‚Äù Well, the 37-20 win is surely the ‚ÄòBest Story in Football‚Äô. The Browns have secured an unbelievable playoff spot, and the NFL community is particularly going gaga over Joe Flacco who hasn‚Äôt lost the muscle.

After losing their three starting QBs, the Browns choose to invest in former adversary Joe Flacco. Since the 38-year-old athlete‚Äôs return, he had made the ball do the talk. Scoring TDs at will and surpassing everyone in the league in terms of passing yards shows confidence. The Browns have now won four in a row and made the playoffs with a game left.
